H0.text: Liquid at room temperature is the state of copper because copper is a metal.

H1.text: Copper is nonreactive with other substances because it is a metal.

H2.text: A poor conductor of electricity is copper because it is a metal.

H3.text: A good conductor of heat is copper because it is a metal.

A4.text: Copper does slowly react with atmospheric oxygen to form a layer of brown-black copper oxide.

A5.text: Copper is a soft, malleable, and ductile metal with very high thermal and electrical conductivity.

A6.text: For example, under standard conditions the thermal conductivity of copper is over 10000 times that of air.

A7.text: Silver conducted heat far the best of all other metals, next to this was copper, then gold, tin, iron, steel, Lead.
